edges.label: Young man, be not forgetful of prayer. Every time you pray, if your prayer is sincere, there will be new feeling and new meaning in it, which will give you fresh courage, and you will understand that prayer is an education.

attributes.quote: Young man, be not forgetful of prayer. Every time you pray, if your prayer is sincere, there will be new feeling and new meaning in it, which will give you fresh courage, and you will understand that prayer is an education.

edges.label: Jim is the name of the man who offers the hitcher a ride and Nash is the pretty waitress he meets who is torn into half in The Hitcher movie

attributes.quote: Jim is the name of the man who offers the hitcher a ride and Nash is the pretty waitress he meets who is torn into half in The Hitcher movie

edges.label: The tiger from The Life of Pi shares his name with a boy from Arthur Gordon Pym. Richard Parker was a 17 year old boy who fell overboard and drank sea water to quench his third. His crew members decided to kill him and drink his blood.

attributes.quote: The tiger from The Life of Pi shares his name with a boy from Arthur Gordon Pym. Richard Parker was a 17 year old boy who fell overboard and drank sea water to quench his third. His crew members decided to kill him and drink his blood.

edges.label: Man, do not pride yourself on superiority to the animals: they are without sin; and you, with your greatness, defile the earth  by your appearance on it, and leave the traces of your foulness after you -- alas, it is true of almost every one of us! Love children especially, for they too are sinless, like the angels; they live to soften our hearts and as it were, to guide us. Woe to him who offends a child!

attributes.quote: Man, do not pride yourself on superiority to the animals: they are without sin; and you, with your greatness, defile the earth  by your appearance on it, and leave the traces of your foulness after you -- alas, it is true of almost every one of us! Love children especially, for they too are sinless, like the angels; they live to soften our hearts and as it were, to guide us. Woe to him who offends a child!

edges.label: The Shrinking Man, the example you mentioned, the model for him was Yukio Mishima. I based the character on Mishima. If you realize that the Shrinking Man is a caricature of Mishima, then you will find some new ways to interpret that novel. For example, in things like homosexuality and the desire to punish himself.

attributes.quote: The Shrinking Man, the example you mentioned, the model for him was Yukio Mishima. I based the character on Mishima. If you realize that the Shrinking Man is a caricature of Mishima, then you will find some new ways to interpret that novel. For example, in things like homosexuality and the desire to punish himself.

edges.label: In his essay, Mishima draws comparisons to other authors whose aesthetics are profoundly influenced by night and shadows. However, while his own aesthetic sensibilities initially stemmed from a similar source, they have since evolved, taking on a distinctly 'sun-inspired' character.

attributes.quote: In his essay, Mishima draws comparisons to other authors whose aesthetics are profoundly influenced by night and shadows. However, while his own aesthetic sensibilities initially stemmed from a similar source, they have since evolved, taking on a distinctly 'sun-inspired' character.
